comment: In a simple graph, the number of neighbors of a vertex is the degree of this vertex. This theorem does not hold for (simple) pseudographs, because a vertex connected with itself only by a loop has no neighbors, see ~ uspgrloopnb0 , but degree 2, see ~ uspgrloopvd2 . And it does not hold for multigraphs, because a vertex connected with only one other vertex by two edges has one neighbor, see ~ umgr2v2enb1 , but also degree 2, see ~ umgr2v2evd2 . (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 17-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 15-Dec-2020.) (Proof shortened by AV, 5-May-2021.)
